abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column observes that compensation for defrauded investors obtained by class action lawsuits far outpaces that obtained by the Securities and Exchange Commission, raising issues of effectiveness; calls on Congress to consider expanding amount that SEC can extract in penalties.
lead_paragraph: The regulator lacks the power to extract fines equal to the losses of harmed investors, often making class-action suits their best recourse.

headline.main: Victims of Financial Wrongdoing Need a More Muscular S.E.C.
headline.print_headline: Victims Need More Muscle From S.E.C.
